poem:
"Lo, the Patron of Patrons"

Swinging iron, a dance mid-air,
Man, in his wisdom he cannot bear.
A single strike to silent ear,
His twenty years, her career.

'Shouldn't be', he muses so,
Golf ball takes its humble throw.
In his arena, woman roams,
She, the monarch, he the drone. 

Offered advice, an echo thin,
In the green world of kin and kin.
